citation.biblCit: Mlačnik, P. and Stanković, P. (2018). Political Jokes in Post-socialist Slovenia, 2017 [Data file]. Ljubljana: Univerza v Ljubljani = University of Ljubljana, Arhiv družboslovnih podatkov = Social Science Data Archives. ADP - IDNo: HUMOR17. https://doi.org/10.17898/ADP_HUMOR17_V1

stdyInfo.abstract: As in all Eastern European countries, political jokes were very popular in Slovenia during the socialist era. In the decades after the fall of socialism, however, political jokes seem to have lost their previous significance. In order to understand what has happened to the political jokes in Slovenia, an analysis of two hundred jokes shared on the five most popular Slovenian Facebook groups has been conducted. The collection consists of classical jokes and nonclassical jokes (anecdotes, witty wisdom, memes). Our goal was to identify the nature of the most frequent targets of jokes and which jokes are the most popular. The data file includes 194 posts, videos (n=6) were not deposited in the archive. Information regarding videos can be found in the codebook.

sumDscr.universe: Non-slovenian Facebook groups, groups that were not very popular and groups that did not have 40 posts.

dataColl.dataCollector: Fakulteta za družbene vede = Faculty of Social Sciences
dataColl.resInstru: Data collection guidelines: Secondary data collection guideDataCollectionGuidelines.SecondaryDataCollectionGuide
dataColl.collSitu: In each Facebook group there were 40 posts chosen on 19th of January 2017, from the most recent to the oldest. Posts were collected with footages of the screen (screenshots) where each footage represents one unit - joke. Time between posts can vary from few days to even a year. The frequency of posts differs from group to group. The oldest joke was posted on 18th of March 2015.

method.stdyClas: 6 - methodological and substantive excellent studies without many implication for a wide range of problems
